titles.title: Save American Free Enterprise Act

A bill to reduce the national debt and eliminate the current slush fund at the Treasury Department by directing that proceeds from the Troubled Asset Relief Program go toward a reduction in the statutory debt limit.
SAFE Act
Save American Free Enterprise Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary: Save American Free Enterprise Act or the SAFE Act - Lowers the statutory public debt limit by the aggregate amounts of $80.893 billion, plus revenues received from the sale of troubled assets purchased, or from the sale, exercise, or surrender of warrants or senior debt instruments acquired, under the Troubled Asset Relief Program (TARP) established by the Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008, including interest and dividends attributable to those amounts after August 7, 2009.
